sentences.en: Adjust to adversity and improvise new directions for your business.
sentences.cn: 适应逆境,随时准备为你的企业设定新方向.

sentences.en: He was a composer of songs and a wonderful conductor, a man who could improvise lines on the moment.
sentences.cn: 他是一些歌曲的作者和一位出色的指挥者, 也是一位能即兴作诗的人.

sentences.en: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.cn: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

sentences.en: I then begin to improvise melodies vocally.
sentences.cn: 接着我开始哼起即兴创作的旋律。

sentences.en: If an actor forgets his words, he has to improvise.
sentences.cn: 演员要是忘记台词, 那就只好即兴现编.

sentences.en: Not wishing to miss church, they decided to improvise.
sentences.cn: 为了赶上礼拜, 他们决定临时举行祈祷仪式.

sentences.en: Sometimes I improvise and change the words because I forget them.
sentences.cn: 有时，我临场发挥改了词，因为我把原来的词给忘了。

sentences.en: The church organist may improvise on a ground bass.
sentences.cn: 教堂风琴手可能以基础低音即兴演奏.

sentences.en: The pianist forgot his music and had to improvise ( the accompaniment ).
sentences.cn: 弹钢琴的人把乐谱忘了,只好即兴伴奏.

sentences.en: The pianist forgot his music and had to improvise.
sentences.cn: 弹钢琴的人把乐谱忘了,只好即兴伴奏.

sentences.en: There isn't much equipment. We're going to have to improvise.
sentences.cn: 设备不多，我们只能将就着用。

sentences.en: They show no disposition to improvise or to take risks.
sentences.cn: 他们不愿意临时凑合或冒险。

sentences.en: We left the tent poles behind, so we had to improvise.
sentences.cn: 我们忘了带帐篷支架, 所以只好临时找别的东西凑合.

sentences.en: When she crashed insteand of going off the mountain, they had to improvise.
sentences.cn: 当她撞了车而不是掉到山下去时, 他们就只得即席表演了.

sentences.en: When you cook, you can improvise with different ingredients.
sentences.cn: 在做饭时, 你可以用不同的配料来应变.

sentences.en: You strum away on your harps like David improvise on musical instruments.
sentences.cn: 弹琴鼓瑟唱消闲的歌曲,为自己制造乐器,如同大卫所造的.

trans.tran_en: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events
